intro: Hippomarathrum libanotis var. cristatum, commonly known as the cristate cypress, is a rare and unique plant species native to the mountainous regions of the Levant. It is characterized by its distinctive, flattened, scale-like leaves that form a dense, cushion-like structure. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically green or yellowish in color. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid climates. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species.
